definition: to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
to take sth to be true
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
to be intensely proud of sth (idiom)
doctors like to treat those who are not sick so that they can get credit for the patient's "recovery" (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 zhi1 hao4 zhi4 bu4 bing4 yi3 wei2 gong1

sentences.english: Melva kisses another guy in front of her boyfriend justifying it to herself as an eye for an eye.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔瓦在男友面前亲吻另一个男孩，自以为报复。

sentences.english: Sometimes a lack of information can lead workers to misperceive that there's preferential treatment, says Mr. Reed.
sentences.chinese: 里德说，有时候信息的缺乏会让员工误以为老板偏心。

sentences.english: Don't bet on winning the game.
sentences.chinese: 不要以为能侥幸赢得比赛。

sentences.english: Don't say that there is no true love, don't let others mistook you seen it all.
sentences.chinese: 别说这世间没有真爱，不要让别人误以为你阅人无数。

sentences.english: K. sobbing so hard I thought she would puke.
sentences.chinese: 她哭得很厉害，我都以为她要吐了。

sentences.english: I shook my head reprovingly, and then she blushed and whispered.
sentences.chinese: 我不以为然地摇摇头，于是她脸红了，小声说。

sentences.english: You think I'm just withholding information because I like hanging out with you?
sentences.chinese: 你以为我会知情不报只为了和你聊天？

sentences.english: The mistake is caused by the situation today, Sheng Maolin too late to regret.
sentences.chinese: 当年的误以为是造成了今天的局面，盛茂林追悔莫及。

sentences.english: But do you imagine that I shall leave Catherine to his duty and humanity?
sentences.chinese: 可是你以为我就会把凯瑟琳交给他的责任和仁爱吗？

sentences.english: Think sports cars and flashy SUVs depreciate the most?
sentences.chinese: 以为跑车，奢华的越野车折价得最多吗？

sentences.english: I thought he was really hurt but he was faking .
sentences.chinese: 我以为他真的受了伤，而他只是在装样子。

sentences.english: I let them think I was one of them.
sentences.chinese: 我让他们以为我也是其中一份子。

sentences.english: If you think he is a good man, think again.
sentences.chinese: 万一你以为他是善人，那你就大谬不然了。

sentences.english: He thought I was signing up for a drawing class in order to see nude girls.
sentences.chinese: 他以为我为了去看裸体姑娘而报名了一个美术课。

sentences.english: Do not think spring does not need compensatory moisture damply .
sentences.chinese: 别以为春天潮湿就不需要补充水分。

sentences.english: I thought he would have gone a bit further to explain how Mao Zedong took over entire China.
sentences.chinese: 我以为他会进一步解释毛是如何打下全中国的。

definition: original/originally/at first/it goes without saying/of course
original/former/originally/formerly/at first/so, actually, as it turns out
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/in spite of everything/in that crazy way/actually/to go as far as to
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
